text.section: No licensed doctor of chiropractic shall advertise or hold himself out to the public in any manner which is false, deceptive, misleading, or as being especially qualified or advanced in any branch of the practice of chiropractic except as certified by the board.

The board shall identify by administrative regulation those specialties of the chiropractic for which certification may be granted and shall establish by administrative regulation the procedures for obtaining and maintaining such certification and the fees therefor.

law.history: Amended 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 126, sec. 2, effective June 24, 2003. -- Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 359, sec. 5, effective June 19, 1976.
